Till then, here are my thoughts on the five books I finished this month.

NON-FICTION

Factfulness by Hans Rosling

ğŸŒ•ğŸŒ•ğŸŒ•ğŸŒ•ğŸŒ‘ If you have the impression that the world is divided into â€œusâ€ vs. â€œthemâ€, the quality of life is not improving, and the world population is terrifyingly increasing ad infinitumâ€“you need to chill and read this book. Hans Rosling reveals 10 instincts that distort our perspective of the world, observed during his experience as a medical doctor, professor of international health, and public educator. When I first read this book two years ago, it drastically changed the way I perceive and think about the world. I also included it in my recommendations of data science books, since it teaches you how to think with data. This month I re-read it for my book club at work and it was a much needed refresher for going through this Covid time.
